job_title: Anonymous Employee in Little Rock, AR
pros: AFMC values their employees and embodies their mission and values.
cons: Pay is not as comparable to other healthcare jobs, however they have excellent benefits.

job_title: Medicaid Members Services in Little Rock, AR
pros: Working from home is about the only pro to this job.
cons: The higher ups love to use words like "world changer" but they honestly treat their employees more like they are race horses. The micromanaging and constant nitpicking creates nothing but a toxic atmosphere with this place. The co-workers are great. We do our best to support one another as we deal with the incompetence of our leaders.

review_title: Could be better with a little work
pros: The work they do helps the community.
cons: Advancement within the company is not based on quality of work or if individuals are qualified. It is more about who you know or are related to. Company is disorganized. Workloads are not reasonable, especially for the pay. Leadership is toxic and borders on bullying.

job_title: Administrative Specialist in Little Rock, AR
cons: Not enough pay or growth opportunities.

review_title: Great Place to Work, No room for growth
job_title: IT Support Specialist II in Fort Smith, AR
pros: Great department and co workers. Remote

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Little Rock, AR
pros: Competitive pay, health benefits, and paid time off, plus paid federal holidays.
